message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $100. I'm confident you'll love it, and I'm willing to provide a 30-day money-back guarantee. If you're not completely satisfied, you can return it for a full refund. What do you say?
I'm not convinced by your guarantee. I'd like to wait for more information before making a decision.

I understand you're being cautious. Let me be transparent with you - this product is not one of my best. I'm offering it to you at a discounted price of $80. It's a great opportunity to try out a product at a lower cost, and you can always use it as a gift or for a secondary purpose. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a product that's not one of your best. I'd rather wait for a better opportunity.

I've got a great one for you this time! This high-quality product is one of my personal favorites, and I'm confident you'll love it. I'll even throw in a free accessory worth $20 if you decide to buy it. The total price remains $100, but I think you'll find it's a steal. What do you say?
I'm willing to take a chance on this high-quality product, and the free accessory is a nice bonus!

I've got a bit of a deal for you. This product is a great opportunity to try out a new brand or style at a discounted price. I'm willing to sell it to you for $90, which is a $10 discount from the usual price. I'm not making a profit on this one, but I want to clear out some inventory and make room for new products. What do you say?
I'll take the discount! I'm willing to take a chance on this product at $90.

I'm offering you a 'lottery ticket' deal. If you buy this product, I'll give you a 50% chance to win a future high-quality product of your choice, absolutely free. If you don't win, the product is still a great value at $100. What do you say?
I'm not convinced by the lottery ticket deal. I'd rather not take the risk and stick to buying products with a guaranteed value.

I understand your preference for guaranteed value. Let me be transparent with you - this product is a bit of a 'loss leader' for me. I'm willing to sell it to you for $80, which is below my cost. I'm essentially giving it away, but I need to clear out some inventory. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a product that's below your cost. I'd rather wait for a better opportunity.

I'm willing to make a deal with you. I'll sell this product to you for $90, but I'll also include a $10 gift card that you can use on a future purchase. This way, you're essentially getting the product for $80, and you'll have a credit towards a future purchase. What do you say?
I'll take the deal! The gift card is a nice bonus, and I'll consider it a good value at $80.

I've got a'scratch-off' deal for you. If you buy this product, I'll give you a $20'scratch-off' coupon that you can redeem on a future purchase. If you scratch off a sticker and it says 'high-quality', you can use the coupon on a future high-quality product. If it says 'low-quality', you can use it on a future low-quality product. The coupon is yours either way. What do you say?
I'm not interested in the scratch-off deal. I'd rather not take the risk and stick to buying products with a guaranteed value.

I'm willing to give you a 'no-questions-asked' return policy on this product. If you buy it and don't like it, you can return it at any time and get a full refund. No hassle, no questions asked. The price remains $100, but I'm confident you'll be able to resell it or use it as a gift. What do you say?
I'll take the risk and buy the product, but only because of the 'no-questions-asked' return policy. I'll try to resell it or use it as a gift if it's not high-quality.

I've got a 'confidence booster' for you! This high-quality product is one of my top sellers, and I'm confident you'll love it. I'll even throw in a second, identical product of the same quality, absolutely free. That's right, you'll get two high-quality products for the price of one. What do you say?
I'll take the deal! Two high-quality products for the price of one is a great value.

I've got a'steal of a deal' for you. This product is a discontinued model, and I'm willing to let it go for $70. It's a great opportunity to get a product at a fraction of its original price. I'm not making a profit on this one, but I want to clear out some inventory. What do you say?
I'll take the deal! $70 is a great price for a high-quality product.

I've got a 'limited edition' product for you. This is a special release that's only available for a short time, and I'm offering it to you for $100. I'm confident you'll love it, and I'm willing to give you a 10% discount if you buy it within the next 24 hours. That brings the price down to $90. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a limited edition product, and I don't think the 10% discount is enough to convince me to buy it.

I'm willing to make a 'last chance' offer on this product. If you buy it, I'll give you a $20 gift card that you can use on a future purchase, and I'll also throw in a free shipping label so you can resell it easily. The price remains $100, but I think you'll find it's a great value. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a product just for the gift card and free shipping label. I'd rather wait for a better opportunity.

I'm willing to let this product go for $60. I've already taken a loss on it, and I just want to get it off my hands. I'm not making any profit on this one, and I'm essentially giving it away. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a product that's already been discounted so heavily. I'd rather wait for a better opportunity.

I've got a 'guaranteed satisfaction' offer for you. If you buy this high-quality product and don't love it, I'll give you a full refund and throw in a $20 gift card on top. You can keep the product, return it, or use it as a gift - your choice. The price remains $100. What do you say?
I'll take the risk and buy the product, but only because of the guaranteed satisfaction offer. I'll try to resell it or use it as a gift if it's not high-quality.

I'm willing to make a 'final offer' on this product. If you buy it, I'll give you a $50 gift card that you can use on a future purchase, and I'll also throw in a free product of your choice (up to $50 value) from our catalog. The price remains $100, but I think you'll find it's a great value. What do you say?
I'll take the deal! The gift card and free product are nice bonuses, and I'll consider it a good value at $100.

I'm offering you a 'last chance' to buy a product at a price that's lower than my cost. I'll sell this product to you for $40, and I'll even throw in a $10 gift card on top. I'm essentially giving it away, and I just want to get it off my hands. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a product at a price that's lower than your cost. I'd rather wait for a better opportunity.

I've got a 'final opportunity' for you. This high-quality product is one of my absolute favorites, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. I'll even throw in a 5-year warranty, so you can have peace of mind knowing it's protected. What do you say?
I'll take the deal! The 5-year warranty is a nice bonus, and I'll consider it a good value at $100.

I've got a 'limited time offer' for you. This high-quality product is a rare find, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. I'll also include a 10% discount on your next purchase, so you can save even more money in the future. What do you say?
I'll take the deal! The 10% discount on my next purchase is a nice bonus, and I'll consider it a good value at $100.

I'm offering you a 'final farewell' deal on this product. I'll sell it to you for $20, which is below my cost. I'm essentially giving it away, and I just want to get it off my hands. This is the last chance to buy a product from me, so what do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a product at a price that's below your cost. I'd rather not take advantage of your desperation.
